com.revolsys.io.xml
Class XmlWriter

java.lang.Object
  java.io.Writer
      com.revolsys.io.xml.XmlWriter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, Flushable, Appendable
Direct Known Subclasses:
KmlXmlWriter
public class XmlWriter
extends Writer

The XmlWriter class is a subclass of Writer that provides additional methods to write XML documents.

Author:
Paul Austin

cdata

public void cdata(String text)
Write the contents in a CDATA section. No escaping will be done on the data the text must not contain "]]>".

Parameters:
text - The text to wrap in a CDATA section
Throws:
IOException - If there was a problem writing the text

closeStartTag

public void closeStartTag()
Close the current open start tag. If a start tag is not open then no action will be taken.

Throws:
IOException - If there was an error writing.

docType

public void docType(String dtd)
Write a DTD section. This string represents the entire doctypedecl production from the XML 1.0 specification.

Parameters:
dtd - The DTD to be written
Throws:
IOException - If there was a problem writing the declaration

public void newLine()

writeAttributeContent

protected void writeAttributeContent(char[] buffer,
                                     int offset,
                                     int length)
Write content for an attribute value to the output, escaping the characters that are used within markup. This method will escape characters ' <', '>', '&', 9, 10, 13 and '"'. Note the XML 1.0 standard does allow '>' to be used unless it is part of "]]>" for simplicity it is allways escaped in this implementation.

Parameters:
buffer - The character buffer to write
offset - The offset in the character data to write
length - The number of characters to write.
Throws:
IOException - If an I/O exception occurs.

writeAttributeValue

protected void writeAttributeValue(String value)
Write the value of an attribute.

Parameters:
value - The value to write.
Throws:
IOException - If an I/O exception occurs.

writeElementContent

protected void writeElementContent(char[] buffer,
                                   int offest,
                                   int length)
Write content for an element to the output, escaping the characters that are used within markup. This method will escape characters ' <', '>' and '&'. Note the XML 1.0 standard does allow '>' to be used unless it is part of "]]>" for simplicity it is allways escaped in this implementation.

Parameters:
buffer - The character buffer to write
offest - The offset in the character data to write
length - The number of characters to write.
Throws:
IOException - If an I/O exception occurs.

                                    String prefix)
